intro: It is a period of civil war. Rebel spaceships, striking from a hidden base, have won their first victory against the evil Galactic Empire.
During the battle, Rebel spies managed to steal secret plans to the Empire's ultimate weapon, the DEATH STAR, an armored space station with enough power to destroy an entire planet.
Pursued by the Empire's sinister agents, Princess Leia races home aboard her starship, custodian of the stolen plans that can save her people and restore freedom to the galaxy...

dialogs.text: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.
What makes you think that?

I thought he might have meant old Ben. Do you know what he is talking about? Well, I wonder if he is related to Ben.
That old man's just a crazy old wizard. Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead and have its memory flushed. That'll be the end of it. It belongs to us now.
But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?

He knew my father?
I told you to forget it. Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow. In the morning I want them on the south ridge working out those condensers.

Yes, sir. I think those new droids are going to work out fine. In fact, I, uh, was also thinking about our agreement about my staying on another season. And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.
You mean the next semester before harvest?

Look, it is only one more season.

Where are you going?

I will make it up to him next year. I promise.

that is what I am afraid of.

Pardon me, sir, but could not we go after him?

Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.
I wish I would known him.
He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior. I understand you have become quite a good pilot yourself. And he was a good friend. Which reminds me.

I have something here for you. Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle would not allow it. He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.
Sir, if you will not be needing me, I will close down for awhile.
Sure, go ahead.
What is it?
Your fathers lightsaber. This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.
An elegant weapon for a more civilized time. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire.
How did my father die?

A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.
The Force?
Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power. it is an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together.
beeps
Now, let  is see if we can not figure out what you are, my little friend. And where you come from.
I saw part of the message he was.
I seem to have found it.

General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars. Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire. I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I am afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed. I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit. My father will know how to retrieve it. You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan. This is our most desperate hour. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you are my only hope.
You must learn the ways of the Force if you are to come with me to Alderaan.
Alderaan? I am not going to Alderaan. I have got to go home. it is late, I am in for it as it is.
I need your help, Luke. She needs your help. I am getting too old for this sort of thing.
I can not get involved! I have got work to do! it is not that I like the Empire. I hate it! But there is nothing I can do about it right now. it is such a long way from here.
that is your uncle talking.
Oh, God, my uncle. How am I ever going to explain this?
Learn about the Force, Luke.
Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead. You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you are going.
You must do what you feel is right, of course.
Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable. The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped. they are more dangerous than you realize.
Dangerous to your starfleet, Commander, not to this battle station!
The Rebellion will continue to gain a support in the Imperial Senate as long as.

The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I have just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.
that is impossible! How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?
The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.
And what of the Rebellion? If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.
The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.

Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they have obtained. This station is now the ultimate power in the universe. I suggest we use it!
do not be too proud of this technological terror you have constructed. The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.

do not try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader. Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes, or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort.
I find your lack of faith disturbing.
Enough of this! Vader, release him!
As you wish.
This bickering is pointless. Lord Vader will provide us with the location of the Rebel fortress by the time this station is operational. We will then crush the Rebellion with one swift stroke.
It looks like Sandpeople did this, all right. Look, here are Gaffi sticks, Bantha tracks. it is just. I never heard of them hitting anything this big before.
They did not. But we are meant to think they did. These tracks are side by side. Sandpeople always ride single file to hide there numbers.
These are the same Jawas that sold us ARTOO and Threepio.
And these blast points, too accurate for Sandpeople. Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise.
Why would Imperial troops want to slaughter Jawas?
If they traced the robots here, they may have learned who they sold them to. And that would lead them home!
Wait, Luke! it is too dangerous.
Uncle Owen! BERU! Uncle Owen!
And, now Your Highness, we will discuss the location of your hidden Rebel base.
there is nothing you could have done, Luke, had you been there. you would have been killed, too, and the droids would be in the hands of the Empire.
I want to come with you to Alderaan. there is nothing here for me now. I want to learn the ways of the Force and become a Jedi like my father.
Mos Eisley Spaceport. You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy. We must be cautious.
How long have you had these droids?
About three or four seasons.
they are for sale if you want them.
Let me see your identification.
You do not need to see his identification.
We do not need to see his identification.
These are not the droids your looking for.
These are not the droids we are looking for.
He can go about his business.
You can go about your business.
Move along.
Move along. Move along.
I can not abide these Jawas. Disgusting creatures.
Go on, go on. I can not understand how we got by those troopers. I thought we were dead.
The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded. You will find it a powerful ally.
Do you really think we are going to find a pilot here that'll take us to Alderaan?
Well, most of the best freighter pilots can be found here. Only watch your step. This place can be a little rough.
I am ready for anything.
Come along, ARTOO.
beeps
We do not serve their kind here!
What?
Your droids. they will have to wait outside. We do not want them here.
Listen, why do not you wait out by the speeder. We do not want any trouble.
I heartily agree with you sir.
Negola dewaghi wooldugger?!?
He does not like you.
I am sorry.
I do not like you either.
do not insult us. You just watch yourself. we are wanted men. I have the death sentence in twelve systems.
I will be careful than.
you will be dead.
This little one is not worth the effort. Come let me buy you something.
This is CHEWBACCA. he is first-mate on a ship that might suit our needs.
I do not like the look of this.
beeps
han-solo. I am captain of the Millennium Falcon. Chewie here tells me you are looking for passage to the Alderaan system.
Yes, indeed. If it is a fast ship.
Fast ship? you have never heard of the Millennium Falcon?
Should I have?
it is the ship that made the Kessel run in less than twelve parsecs!
I have outrun Imperial starships, not the local bulk-cruisers, mind you. I am talking about the big Corellian ships now. She is fast enough for you, old man. what is the cargo?
Only passengers. Myself, the boy, two droids, and no questions asked.
What is it? Some kind of local trouble?
let  is just say we would like to avoid any Imperial entanglements.
Well, that is the trick, is not it? And it is going to cost you something extra. Ten thousand in advance.
Ten thousand? We could almost buy our own ship for that!
But who is going to fly it, kid! You?
You bet I could. I am not such a bad pilot myself! We do not have to sit here and listen.
We have not that much with us. But we could pay you two thousand now, plus fifteen when we reach Alderaan.
Seventeen, huh!
Okay. You guys got yourself a ship. we will leave as soon as you are ready. Docking bay Ninety-four.
Ninety-four.
Looks like somebody's beginning to take an interest in your handiwork.
barks
Seventeen thousand! Those guys must really be desperate. This could really save my neck. Get back to the ship and get her ready.
you will have to sell your speeder.
that is okay. I am never coming back to this planet again.
Going somewhere, Solo?
Yes, Greedo. As a matter of fact, I was just going to see your boss. Tell Jabba that I have got his money.

it is too late. You should have paid him when you had the chance. Jabba's put a price on your head, so large that every bounty hunter in the galaxy will be looking for you. I am lucky I found you first.
Yeah, but this time I got the money.
If you give it to me, I might forget I found you.
I do not have it with me. Tell Jabba.
Jabba's through with you. He has no time for smugglers who drop their shipments at the first sign of an Imperial cruiser.
Even I get boarded sometimes. Do you think I had a choice?
You can tell that to Jabba. He may only take your ship.
Over my dead body.
that is the idea. I have been looking forward to killing you for a long time.
Yes, I will bet you have.
Sorry about the mess.
Her resistance to the mind probe is considerable. It will be some time before we can extract any information from her.
The final check-out is complete. All systems are operational. What course shall we set?
Perhaps she would respond to an alternative form of persuasion.
What do you mean?
I think it is time we demonstrate the full power of this station. Set your course for Princess Leia's home planet of Alderaan.
With pleasure.
Lock the door, ARTOO.
beeps
I would much rather have gone with Master Luke than stay here with you. I do not know what all the trouble is about, but I am sure it must be your fault.
beeps
You watch your language!
beeps
He says it is the best he can do. Since the came out, they are just not in demand.
dialogs.where: EXT. TATOOINE - MOS EISLEY - STREET - ALLEYWAY - USED SPEEDER LOT

dialogs.text: It will be enough.
dialogs.where: EXT. TATOOINE - MOS EISLEY - STREET - ALLEYWAY - USED SPEEDER LOT

dialogs.text: If the ship's as fast as he is boasting, we ought to do well.
dialogs.where: EXT. TATOOINE - MOS EISLEY - STREET - ALLEYWAY - USED SPEEDER LOT

dialogs.text: Come on out, Solo!
I have been waiting for you, Jabba.
I expected you would be.
I am not the type to run.
Han, my boy, there are times when you disappoint me. why have not you paid me? And why did you have to fry poor Greedo like that. after all we have been through together.
You sent Greedo to blast me.
Han, why you are the best smuggler in the business. you are too valuable to fry. He was only relaying my concern at your delays. He was not going to blast you.
I think he thought he was. Next time do not send one of those twerps. If you have got something to say to me, come see me yourself.

Han, Han! If only you hadn't had to dump that shipment of spice. you understand I just can not make an exception. Where would I be if every pilot who smuggled for me dumped their shipment at the first sign of an Imperial starship? it is not good business.
You know, even I get boarded sometimes, Jabba. I had no choice, but I have got a charter now and I can pay you back, plus a little extra. I just need some more time.

Put your blasters away. Han, my boy, I am only doing this because you are the best and I need you. So, for an extra, say twenty percent I will give you a little more time. but this is it. If you disappoint me again, I will put a price on your head so large you will not be able to go near a civilized system for the rest of your short life.
Jabba, I will pay you because it is my pleasure.
What a piece of junk.
dialogs.where: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94

dialogs.text: SHe will make point five beyond the speed of light. She may not look like much, but she is got it where it counts, kid. I have added some special modifications myself.
dialogs.where: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94

dialogs.text: we are a little rushed, so if you will hurry aboard we will get out of here.
dialogs.where: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94

dialogs.text: Hello, sir.
dialogs.where: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94

dialogs.text: Chewie, get us out of here!
Oh, my. I would forgotten how much I hate space travel.
beeps
It looks like an Imperial cruiser. Our passengers must be hotter than I thought. Try and hold them off. Angle the deflector shield while I make the calculations for the jump to light speed.
Stay sharp! There are two more coming in; they are going to try to cut us off.
Why do not you outrun them? I thought you said this thing was fast.
Watch your mouth, kid, or you are going to find yourself floating home. we will be safe enough once we make the jump to hyperspace. Besides, I know a few maneuvers. we will lose them!
Here's where the fun begins!
How long before you can make the jump to light speed?
it will take a few moments to get the coordinates from the navi-computer.
Are you kidding? At the rate they are gaining.

Traveling through hyperspace is not like dusting crops, boy! Without precise calculations we could fly right through a star or bounce too close to a supernova and that'd end your trip real quick, would not it?
what is that flashing?
we are losing our deflector shield. Go strap yourself in, I am going to make the jump to light speed.
we have entered the Alderaan system.
Governor Tarkin, I should have expected to find you holding Vader's leash. I recognized your foul stench when I was brought on board.
Charming to the last. You do not know how hard I found it signing the order to terminate your life!
I surprised you had the courage to take the responsibility yourself!
Princess Leia, before your execution I would like you to be my guest at a ceremony that will make this battle station operational. No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.
The more you tighten your grip, Tarkin, the more star systems will slip through your fingers.

Not after we demonstrate the power of this station. In a way, you have determined the choice of the planet that'll be destroyed first. Since you are reluctant to provide us with the location of the Rebel base, I have chosen to test this station's destructive power, on your home planet of Alderaan.
No! Alderaan is peaceful. We have no weapons. You can not possibly.
You would prefer another target? A military target? Then name the system!
I grow tired of asking this. So it will be the last time. Where is the Rebel base?
Dantooine.
they are on Dantooine.
There. You see Lord Vader, she can be reasonable. Continue with the operation. You may fire when ready.
What?
you are far too trusting. Dantooine is too remote to make an effective demonstration. But do not worry. We will deal with your Rebel friends soon enough.
No!
Are you all right? what is wrong?
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: I felt a great disturbance in the Force. as if millions of voices suddenly cried out in terror and were suddenly silenced. I fear something terrible has happened.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: you would better get on with your exercises.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Well, you can forget your troubles with those Imperial slugs. I told you I would outrun 'em.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: do not everyone thank me at once.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Anyway, we should be at Alderaan about oh two-hundred hours.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Now be careful, ARTOO.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: beeps
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: He made a fair move. Screaming about it will not help you.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Let him have it. it is not wise to upset a Wookiee.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: that is 'cause droids do not pull people's arms out of their socket when they lose. Wookiees are known to do that.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: I see your point, sir. I suggest a new strategy, ARTOO. Let the Wookiee win.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Remember, a Jedi can feel the Force flowing through him.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: You mean it controls your actions?
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Partially. But it also obeys your commands.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Hokey religions and ancient weapons are no match for a good blaster at your side, kid.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: You do not believe in the Force, do you?
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Kid, I have flown from one side of this galaxy to the other. I have seen a lot of strange stuff, but I have never seen anything to make me believe there is one all-powerful force controlling everything. there is no mystical energy field that controls my destiny.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: it is all a lot of simple tricks and nonsense.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: I suggest you try it again, Luke.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: This time, let go your conscious self and act on instinct.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: With the blast shield down, I can not even see. How am I supposed to fight?
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Your eyes can deceive you. do not trust them.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Stretch out with your feelings.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: You see, you can do it.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: I call it luck.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: In my experience, there is no such thing as luck.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Look, going good against remotes is one thing. Going good against the living? that is something else.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Looks like we are coming up on Alderaan.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: You know, I did feel something. I could almost see the remote.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: that is good. You have taken your first step into a larger world.
dialogs.where: INT. MILLENNIUM FALCON - CENTRAL HOLD AREA

dialogs.text: Yes.

Our scout ships have reached Dantooine. They found the remains of a Rebel base, but they estimate that it has been deserted for some time. They are now conducting an extensive search of the surrounding systems.
She lied! She lied to us!
I told you she would never consciously betray the Rebellion.
Terminate her. immediately!
Stand by, Chewie, here we go. Cut in the sublight engines.
barks
What the.? Aw, we have come out of hyperspace into a meteor shower. Some kind of asteroid collision. it is not on any of the charts.
what is going on?
Our position is correct, except. no, Alderaan!
What do you mean? Where is it?
Thats what I am trying to tell you, kid. It is not there. it is been totally blown away.
What? How?
Destroyed. by the Empire!
The entire starfleet could not destroy the whole planet. It'd take a thousand ships with more fire power than I have.
there is another ship coming in.
Maybe they know what happened.
it is an Imperial fighter.
barks
It followed us!
No. it is a short range fighter.
There are not any bases around here. Where did it come from?
It sure is leaving in a big hurry. If they identify us, we are in big trouble.
Not if I can help it. Chewie.jam it is transmissions.
It'd be as well to let it go. it is too far out of range.
Not for long.
A fighter that size could not get this deep into space on its own.
It must have gotten lost, been part of a convoy or something.
Well, he is not going to be around long enough to tell anyone about us
Look at him. he is headed for that small moon.
I think I can get him before he gets there. he is almost in range.
that is no moon! it is a space station.
it is too big to be a space station.
I have a very bad feeling about this.
Yeah, I think your right. Full reverse! Chewie, lock in the auxiliary power.
barks
Why are we still moving towards it?
we are caught in a tractor beam! it is pulling us in!
But there is gotta be something you can do!
there is nothin' I can do about it, kid. I am in full power. I am going to have to shut down. But they are not going to get me without a fight!
You can not win. But there are alternatives to fighting.
Yes.
we have captured a freighter entering the remains of the Alderaan system. it is markings match those of a ship that blasted its way out of Mos Eisley.
They must be trying to return the stolen plans to the princess. She may yet be of some use to us.
Unlock one-five-seven and nine. Release charges.
there is no one on board, sir. According to the log, the crew abandoned ship right after takeoff. It must be a decoy, sir. Several of the escape pods have been jettisoned.
Did you find any droids?
No, sir. If there were any on board, they must also have jettisoned.
Send a scanning crew on board. I want every part of this ship checked.
Yes, sir.
I sense something. a presence I have not felt since.
Get me a scanning crew in here on the double. I want every part of this ship checked!
Boy, it is lucky you had these compartments.
I use them for smuggling. I never thought I would be smuggling myself in them. This is ridiculous. Even if I could take off, I would never get past the tractor beam.
Leave that to me!
Damn fool. I knew that you were going to say that!
who is the more foolish. the fool or the fool who follows him?
barks
The ship's all yours. If the scanners pick up anything, report it immediately. All right, let  is go.

dialogs.text: Hey down there, could you give us a hand with this?
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - MAIN FORWARD BAY

dialogs.text: TX-four one-two. Why are not you at your post? TX-four one-two, do you copy?

dialogs.text: Take over. we have got a bad transmitter. I will see what I can do.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: You know, between his howling and your blasting everything in sight, it is a wonder the whole station does not know we are here.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Bring them on! I prefer a straight fight to all this sneaking around.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: We found the computer outlet, sir.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Plug in. He should be able to interpret the entire Imperial computer network.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: He says he is found the main computer to power the tractor beam that is holding the ship here. He will try to make the precise location appear on the monitor.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: The tractor beam is coupled to the main reactor in seven locations. A power loss at one of the terminals will allow the ship to leave.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: I do not think you boys can help. I must go alone.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Whatever you say. I have done more that I bargained for on this trip already.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: I want to go with you.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Be patient, Luke. Stay and watch over the droids.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: But he can.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: They must be delivered safely or other star systems will suffer the same fate as Alderaan. Your destiny lies along a different path than mine. The Force will be with you. always!

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Boy you said it, Chewie.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Where did you dig up that old fossil?
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Ben is a great man.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Yeah, great at getting us into trouble.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: I did not hear you give any ideas.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Well, anything would be better than just hanging around waiting for him to pick us up.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Who do you think.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: What is it?
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: I am afraid I am not quite sure, sir. He says "I found her", and keeps repeating, "She is here."
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Well, who. who has he found?
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: barks
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Princess Leia.
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: The princess? She is here?
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Princess? what is going on?
dialogs.where: INT. DEATH STAR - FORWARD BAY - COMMAND OFFICE

dialogs.text: Level five. Detention block A A twenty-three. I am afraid she is scheduled to be terminated.
